ranked_diseases.explanation: Familial Amyloid Polyneuropathy is known to cause amyloidosis of peripheral nerves and can lead to gastrointestinal symptoms such as chronic diarrhea and constipation due to autonomic neuropathy.
This condition involves amyloid deposition and can present with gastrointestinal issues, although peripheral nerve involvement is more typical in polyneuropathy forms.
Hereditary Gelsolin Amyloidosis can lead to amyloid deposition, sometimes affecting peripheral nerves. It can have systemic effects, including some gastrointestinal manifestations.
